trend_summary: Over the time series, the corridor-villages remain small but farmland patches and clearings steadily enlarge, nibbling into surrounding forest. A modest expansion of housing clusters occurs west of the central roadway, yet most hills stay wooded. Overall built-up areas stay sparse and the landscape keeps a predominantly rural character with increasing agricultural footprint.
notable_changes: Progressive enlargement of light-colored cropland blocks, especially in the northeast and south-central valleys.
Small new housing clusters and infill along the main east-west road, most visible in later images.
Minor extension of secondary roads and tracks connecting new clearings.
Reduction in continuous forest cover on lower slopes; hillsides show more patchy vegetation.
Seasonal or vegetation-management shift evident in final image, with extensive brown, recently cleared surfaces.
